baselineSource: Prior audit snapshot provided in thread (2026-02-15).

findings.finding: Resolved in Phase 2: package is now ESM-primary with explicit dual import/require export conditions and dual build outputs.

evidence.note: exports define both import and require conditions
local consumer require/import export matrix coverage

findings.impact: Consumer module loading contract is now explicit and verified across ESM and CJS entry points.
findings.recommendation: Keep dual build/export matrix in CI and preserve import/require compatibility tests for future dependency upgrades.

findings.finding: Engine policy remains Node >=22.
findings.impact: Compatibility footprint is narrower than necessary for many users.
findings.recommendation: Re-evaluate minimum Node support and expand CI matrix if policy changes.
verification: Matrix CI run on 20/22/24 (if policy updated)

findings.finding: Resolved in Phase 2: stable runner API is now exported on @imageforge/cli/runner (subpath-only contract).

evidence.note: asserts runner is available on subpath and absent from root
verifies runner subpath in installed tarball
documents stable subpath runner API for ESM/CJS

findings.impact: Programmatic consumers can call the full pipeline runner directly without shelling out to the CLI.
findings.recommendation: Maintain SemVer stability for @imageforge/cli/runner and keep root API intentionally runner-free.

findings.finding: Key DX ergonomics remain missing: dry-run, include/exclude globs, init scaffold.

evidence.note: config keys do not include include/exclude patterns

findings.impact: Harder adoption and selective processing in mixed repos.
findings.recommendation: Add staged DX enhancements for previewing and filtering work.
verification: CLI integration tests for new flags/commands

findings.finding: Input discovery still excludes webp/avif/svg source files.
findings.impact: Migration friction for teams already using modern source formats.
findings.recommendation: Add support or publish explicit roadmap/limitation guidance.
verification: Discovery and processing tests for any newly supported formats

findings.finding: Core implementation and tests remain monolithic.
findings.impact: Higher change risk and slower debugging/refactoring.
findings.recommendation: Split by responsibility (cache/preflight/report/tests by module).
verification: Refactor with unchanged behavioral snapshots and full test pass

findings.finding: Test surface expanded, but runner internals still lack direct edge-case unit coverage.
findings.impact: Critical failure paths can still regress silently.
findings.recommendation: Add focused unit tests for cache atomicity, preflight corrupt images with widths, and invalid orientation values.
verification: pnpm test with new targeted test cases

findings.finding: npx execution is now tested, but only after tarball install in a consumer project.

evidence.note: npx imageforge tested after npm install tarball

findings.impact: Direct one-shot npx package resolution remains untested.
findings.recommendation: Add isolated remote-style npx scenario without pre-install.
verification: Extended e2e test case for direct package execution

findings.finding: Per-file logging prints raw relative paths without control character sanitization.
findings.impact: Possible ANSI/log injection via crafted file names.
findings.recommendation: Escape or strip control characters before terminal output.
verification: Log-safety test with crafted filename containing escape sequences

findings.finding: Hashing currently loads entire file into memory synchronously.
findings.impact: Large files can increase memory pressure and destabilize runs.
findings.recommendation: Use streaming hash computation and enforce max file size controls.

findings.finding: Resolved in Phase 1: enabled benchmark sources are pinned and source fetch is fail-closed by default.

evidence.note: enabled sources now carry pinned sha256 values
strict defaults with explicit waiver flags
missing/invalid sha256 fails unless waiver enabled
non-partial runs exit nonzero on failures

findings.impact: Open-license source provenance and availability are now enforced by default during dataset fetch.
findings.recommendation: Keep source hashes pinned and use waiver flags only for controlled recovery scenarios.

findings.finding: Resolved in Phase 1: dataset release flow enforces immutable tags and create-only publishing.

evidence.note: preflight asserts tag absence before release
nonzero exit when immutable tag already exists

findings.impact: Existing benchmark dataset tags and release assets cannot be overwritten in place.
findings.recommendation: Continue semantic version bumps for any dataset content change.

findings.finding: Benchmark regression signaling remains advisory-only.
findings.impact: Regressions can merge without explicit override decision.
findings.recommendation: Introduce optional strict mode for release/hardening contexts.
verification: Workflow strict-mode simulation with induced regression

findings.finding: Resolved in Phase 1: benchmark sync now avoids tokenized git URLs and redacts failure output.

evidence.note: remote URL no longer embeds token
askpass credential flow for git auth
central secret redaction for command failures
temporary credential helper cleanup in finally
failure-path test asserts token is not leaked

findings.impact: Token leakage risk in git command arguments and failure logs is significantly reduced.
findings.recommendation: Retain redaction coverage tests for future sync-script changes.
verification: pnpm exec vitest run tests/benchmark-tools.test.ts --reporter verbose

findings.finding: Shared helper/constants remain duplicated across modules.
findings.impact: Behavioral drift risk on future edits.
findings.recommendation: Centralize common guards/constants.
verification: pnpm run typecheck && pnpm test after extraction

findings.finding: Release Please manifest tracking is now explicit and wired.
findings.impact: Release automation state clarity improved.
findings.recommendation: Keep release metadata contract under CI validation.

findings.finding: Site now ships a benchmark evidence route backed by synced snapshot JSON.

evidence.note: source sha references audited CLI main

findings.impact: Claim traceability and credibility improved.
findings.recommendation: Maintain sync cadence and stale snapshot alerting.

findings.finding: Analytics and Speed Insights are now integrated with browser opt-out controls.
findings.impact: Prior analytics gap is closed.
findings.recommendation: Add event-level validation when custom events are enabled.

findings.finding: googleapis remains in production dependencies despite script-only usage.
findings.impact: Unnecessary runtime dependency surface and audit scope expansion.
findings.recommendation: Move googleapis to devDependencies.

findings.finding: Pricing as-of constants are still hardcoded to February 11, 2026.
findings.impact: Risk of stale external pricing claims over time.
findings.recommendation: Automate stale-claim detection with a blocking freshness threshold.
verification: Scheduled freshness check in CI/governance workflow

findings.finding: Interactive UI surface grew, but component-level tests are still absent.

evidence.note: tests cover scripts, not React components

findings.impact: Higher chance of unnoticed keyboard/clipboard/motion regressions.
findings.recommendation: Add component/integration tests for core landing and benchmark interactions.
verification: Add and run UI component test suite in CI

findings.finding: Animation safety gate now runs canonical + fixture checks and passed in this audit.
findings.impact: Core safety controls are now continuously verifiable.
findings.recommendation: Keep strict gates for safety and advisory scoring for style density.

findings.finding: H1 audit logic overcounts by scanning source files globally, yielding persistent high-noise warnings.

evidence.note: high warning triggered: Expected one H1, found 3

findings.impact: Signal-to-noise degradation in SEO checks can mask true issues.
findings.recommendation: Evaluate H1 per route render output, not source-text global count.
verification: pnpm run seo:check after rule update

findings.finding: CI-parity checks use example.com and generate predictable off-page metadata warnings.
findings.impact: Advisory output contains expected env-noise unrelated to production metadata.
findings.recommendation: Skip/adjust public-metadata check when placeholder domain is in use.
verification: pnpm run check:ci with placeholder-aware SEO mode

findings.finding: No explicit security headers are configured in Next.js config.
findings.impact: Missed defense-in-depth opportunity for browser-side protections.
findings.recommendation: Add baseline security headers and validate compatibility.

findings.finding: No first-party docs/blog/contact routes; docs/changelog are external links.
findings.impact: Limits long-tail discoverability and direct feedback capture.
findings.recommendation: Add lightweight first-party docs and feedback entrypoint.
verification: Route smoke tests for new docs/feedback paths

findings.finding: Action pinning remains mixed between SHA-pinned and floating tags.
findings.impact: Inconsistent supply-chain risk control and update governance.
findings.recommendation: Adopt one pinning policy and enforce it automatically.

findings.finding: Main branch local quality gate is currently red due doc formatting drift.

evidence.note: one of flagged files in current check output

findings.impact: Red gate adds noise to release readiness and local CI parity.
findings.recommendation: Normalize formatting baseline or scope gate exclusions for archival docs.

findings.finding: Prod dependency audit is currently non-deterministic due external npm audit endpoint failures.

evidence.note: production deps are subject to audit command

findings.impact: Security scan reliability gap when audit service is unavailable.
findings.recommendation: Add retry/backoff policy and fallback scanner path in CI.
verification: pnpm audit with fallback path validation

findings.finding: No unified workflow action pinning policy across both repositories.

evidence.note: mixed pinning strategy in site workflows

findings.impact: Inconsistent security posture and governance overhead across repos.
findings.recommendation: Define org-level policy and enforce via automated workflow checks.

findings.finding: Check mode now provides per-file needs-processing output in addition to rerun command.
findings.impact: Improved CI/debug feedback compared with prior audit baseline.
findings.recommendation: Maintain this behavior and preserve parity in JSON mode metadata.

findings.finding: Coverage and mutation-style assurance strategy remains incomplete across CLI and site UI layers.

evidence.note: script tests present, no UI component coverage layer

findings.impact: Regression detection strength is hard to quantify over time.
findings.recommendation: Introduce coverage reporting first, then targeted mutation/fault-injection for critical paths.
verification: CI coverage artifact publication and trend tracking

findings.finding: Current animation safety checks validate structural safety but do not measure rendering smoothness or visual drift (FPS/frame-drop or screenshot diff).

evidence.note: Checks focus on overflow, reduced-motion parity, and critical content visibility
Collector records structural page metrics, not frame performance
Workflow runs animation:check without visual/fps regression suite

findings.impact: Motion-quality regressions can pass existing gates while still degrading UX polish and readability under load.
findings.recommendation: Add LHCI and targeted Playwright visual snapshots as complementary non-blocking checks before any threshold hard-gating.
verification: Planned: Playwright screenshot regression suite for / and /benchmarks/latest
